page.description: Fires before every Ajax callback made to the server.

discussion.p: Fires when an Ajax callback is made to the server. You can use this event to authorize the callback action. The *[xb:e]* variable contains information about the callback you can reference in your Xbasic code.

If you want to prevent the Ajax callback from executing, set the *[xb:e.authorized]* variable to *[xb:.f.]*. If you do not set the *[xb:e.authorized]* variable or set the value to *[xb:.t.]*, the callback will be executed.
Javascript can be returned from the function using the *[xb:e.javascript]* variable.

section.note: The canAjaxCallback server-side event previously would only emit user-defined Javascript if the event denied permission for the callback. Now, user defined Javascript can be emitted even if the Ajax callback is allowed. *[This change was made in Alpha Anywhere build 4307]* to support the [Mobile Application with Persistent Login] pattern.

section.title: Available Variables in the 'e' Object
section.description: Several variables are available for reading or setting in the *[xb:canAjaxCallback]* event. These variables are properties of the *[xb:e]* object. The variables in the *[xb:e]* object include:

item.name: e.tmpl
item.description: The definition of the UX Component.

item.name: e.callbackFunctionName
item.description: The name of the Ajax callback function that will b called.

section.description: Your code can set the following variables in the *[xb:e]* object:

item.name: e.javascript
item.description: Javascript to return to the client and execute.

item.name: e.authorized
item.description: A *[xb:.t.]* or *[xb:.f.]* value. If you do not set the value for this property, then authorized is assumed to be *[xb:.t.]*. If authorized is *[xb:.f.]*, the callback action is not performed.

tip.p: When working in Live Preview you can get the names of the simulated security groups using this variable: *[xb:e.tmpl.Livepreview_permissions_friendly]*
When running in a real application, you can get the names of the security groups for the logged in using using: [Context.Security.GetUserRoles()]
